briefTitle: Effect of High Dose Fish Oil Supplementation After Recent Heart Attack Using Magnetic Resonance Imaging

armGroups.label: Omega-3 Fatty Acids
interventionNames: Drug: Omega-3 Fatty Acids (Fish Oil Supplements)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Experienced a heart attack in the 2 to 4 weeks before study entry
* Lives in the greater Boston area or adjacent regions (within a 50-mile radius of Boston)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Unable to undergo an MRI because of metallic implants (e.g., pacemakers, an implantable cardioverter defibrillator \[AICD\]) at time of study entry
* Active cancer or any other terminal illness with an expected survival rate of less than 6 months after study entry
* Significant kidney dysfunction with a glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of less than 60 mL/min in the 2 weeks before study entry
* Inability to follow study procedures
* Pregnant
* Hemodynamic instability
* Urgent clinical need for a pacemaker or AICD
* Inaccessibility of medical records

outcomeMeasures.title: Effect of Omega-3 Fatty Acids on Adverse Left Ventricular Remodeling
outcomeMeasures.description: Measured as change in left ventricular end-systolic volume indexed to body surface area from baseline to post-treatment (6-months)

outcomeMeasures.title: Effect of Omega-3 Fatty Acids on Non-Infarct Myocardial Fibrosis
outcomeMeasures.description: Measured as change in myocardial extracellular volume fraction of non-infarcted myocardium from baseline to post-treatment (6-months)

outcomeMeasures.title: Effect of Omega-3 Fatty Acids on Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
outcomeMeasures.description: Measured as change in left ventricular ejection fraction from baseline to post-treatment (6-months)

outcomeMeasures.title: Effect of Omega-3 Fatty Acids on Infarct Size
outcomeMeasures.description: Measured as change in infarct size from baseline to post-treatment (6-months)
